name: 黃盈庭
objective: The applications of power electronics include electric vehicles, lighting, power systems, transportation, etc. The goal of this course is to help students understand the basic principles of power electronics and to integrate the comprehensive applications of electronic, circuit, and electromagnetic disciplines.
schedule:
Week 1：Introduction of power electronics and components
Week 2：PCB Prototyping Machine training (B10-12)
Week 3：Description of converter circuit topologies
Week 4：LCR meter training (B10-12)
Week 5：Principle and design of non-isolated converters
Week 6：Principle and design of isolated converters
Week 7：Altium Designer software
Week 8：State-space average method and feedback compensation controller
Week 9：Midterm exam
Week 10：Hardware implementation #1 (B05-1)
Week 11：Hardware implementation #2 (B05-1)
Week 12：Term project interim report #1
Week 13：Loss analysis of the power converters
Week 14：Hardware implementation #3 (B05-1)
Week 15：Term project interim report #2
Week 16：Hardware implementation #4 (B05-1)
Week 17：New Year's Day
Week 18：Term project final report
scorePolicy:
Attendance & Performance：20%
Midterm exam：30%
Interim report：30%
Final report：20%
materials:
1.Lecture notes
2.Power Electronics: Converters, Applications and Design (Mohan, Ned/ Undeland, Tore M./ Robbins, William P.)
consultation: There will be teaching assistant's consultation hours to allow students to ask questions after class. The professor can also be contacted via email to discuss the questions.
課程對應SDGs指標: SDG7：可負擔的潔淨能源（Affordable and Clean Energy）
